Note sure what the steps, something like:

1- was in resource perspective
2- had a "compare with latest" editor open
3- created a new java project, this opened a java perspective
4- created a class

I've tried those steps but can't reproduce the bug, but its something close to 
it.  

Got the exception below.  Note the java perspective opened in (3) was opened as 
a side effect of that step, so there was no sync view in it.  If I had had sync 
views open in (1) (likely), it was as a fast view.  Looking at the stack dump 
it looks like I tried to sync the project, but I couldn't have because it was 
new (and not shared).

Pray tell, what was the number of the Eclipse build you were using when this
happened?
It was the one just prior to freeze 2.

I just got the same or very similar exception (stack trace below) with latest 
integration build (20020607). The exception occured when I was synchronizing 
*outgoing* changes to a directory. 'Synchrinize with repository' for the same 
directory worked fine. All my files are under cvs control, i.e. i did not 
create new projects or files. Rstarting eclipse and/or refreshing from local 
does not make any difference.

It turned out that I did delete file from the directory and it was the only 
outgoing change. Steps to reptoduce 

1. Checkout something from repository (does not have to be java)
2. Delete a file
3. 'Synchronize outgoing changes'

It appears that it is not even necessary to delete the file. Simply checking out
a project & attempting to sync outgoing changes will generate the NPE. This
happens because it tries to pass the result of SyncCompareOutput.getDiffRoot()
into another function. Unfortunately, SyncCompareOutput.diffRoot is null at this
stage so a NULL ref gets passed in & that is what triggers the stack trace. It
looks like diffRoot is niot being set when it should.
